meanings.definition: To enclose or fortify with a palisade.
meanings.sent1: The settlers were palisading their village to protect it from wild animals.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were palisading the perimeter of the camp for added security.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended they were palisading their treehouse to keep out imaginary invaders.
meanings.sent4: Her determination palisaded her heart against any doubts or fears.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the flowers palisaded the garden, creating a beautiful border.

meanings.definition: A fence of wooden stakes or iron railings fixed in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The old farm had a sturdy palisading around its fields to keep the livestock safe.
meanings.sent2: The historic site was surrounded by a palisading to recreate its original appearance.
meanings.sent3: The children used sticks to create a small palisading for their pretend fort.
meanings.sent4: The palisading along the riverbank stood strong against the force of the water.
meanings.sent5: The palisading in the park added a rustic charm to the landscape.
